conclusion: Analyze the motion of a charged particle in a magnetic field using the relationship between magnetic induction intensities and velocity.
Identify given information: particle moves perpendicularly to interface MN between two uniform magnetic fields, B1 = 2B2, enters field B1 at point O.
Magnetic force F acting on particle is F = qvB, where v is velocity, B is magnetic induction intensity, q is charge.
Magnetic force equals change in momentum: F = Δp = mv - m(0) = mv, where m is mass.
Time t for particle to pass through point O is t = Δp/F = mv/qB.
Given B1 = 2B2, time t is t = mv/(q × 2B2) = mv/(2qB).
Since particle moves downward again, time t is same as time to pass through point O.
Particle will pass through point O again after same time t.
